definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: Mark Viduka's missed header in the first half.
sentences.chinese: 维杜卡上半场错失的那个头球。

sentences.english: If you stick to Google, you'll also miss out on social searching.
sentences.chinese: 假如你死盯Google，你将错失社会化搜索。

sentences.english: Take it easy, but take it.
sentences.chinese: 放轻松，但是不要错失良机。

sentences.english: How do you find a thing you have mislaid or forgotten?
sentences.chinese: 你如何找回你已经错失或遗忘的东西哩？

sentences.english: Barak says this is an opportunity not to be missed.
sentences.chinese: 巴拉克说，这是一个不能错失的机会。

sentences.english: To sentiment reason which late comes, treasures well, no longer error predestined match.
sentences.chinese: 对迟来的情缘，好好珍惜，不再错失良缘。

sentences.english: And, along the way, we’re sabotaging our chances.
sentences.chinese: 顺着这条路，我们正错失机会。

sentences.english: If you've missed the falling dollar rally to date, don't do anything stupid.
sentences.chinese: 如果你错失了迄今为止的美元下跌的反弹，别做傻事。

sentences.english: The widespread concern is that a home-educated child misses out on"socialisation".
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍认为在家教育孩子会错失孩子的社会意识。

sentences.english: 'They cannot afford not to participate, ' Mr. Gheit said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，这些公司无法承受错失机会的后果。

sentences.english: It was a missed opportunity as well.
sentences.chinese: 它还是一个错失的良机。

sentences.english: Sinclair also just missed the target when one on one with the goalkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 辛克莱尔同样在禁区里1对1时错失良机。

sentences.english: Too often we miss beautiful sources of inspiration, because we’re too busy thinking about other things.
sentences.chinese: 由于忙于思考或其他琐事，我们经常错失灵感的泉源。

sentences.english: Yao layup. Mike James missed free throw.
sentences.chinese: 姚明上篮，詹姆斯错失罚球。

sentences.english: Usually we don't miss free-throws like that.
sentences.chinese: 通常我们不会像今天一样错失罚球。

sentences.english: I lost the two finals and also missed that black which has since given me a few sleepless nights.
sentences.chinese: 我输掉了两场决赛，同时也因睡眠不足而错失了黑球。

definition: to miss narrowly/to let a great opportunity slip
lapse/mistake/to make a mistake/fault/service fault (in volleyball, tennis etc)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to suffer the painful loss of (a loved one etc)/to miss out on (an opportunity)/to fail to gain (victory etc)
to hold a funeral procession and burial/to give sb a final send-off/(fig.) to ruin (one's future prospects etc)
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
